ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The history of patent at the intersection of intellectual property law is well narrated and portrayed by the readings and discussions of this class. I would recommend it to another student who wishes to understand why the patent system exist as it does today in relation to its history.

I would recommend this course. Best described as an overview of issues and instances concerning biotechnology and patent law, with primary source readings that help situate discussion in secondary texts. The focus is on America, with occasional glances across the Atlantic.
Yes! I described it to several other students as a sort of history of biocapital combined with a history of intellectual property.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I'm not sure if the subject matter of this course will directly contribute to my dissertation, but I appreciated being introduced to new perspectives.
It introduced my to a field I have not yet encountered during my studies. It provided new approaches and further research topics for the future.
